lexUnit.name: warm.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: reminescent of the colors of something that gives heat

sentence.text: Its stonework and that of the cathedral glowed a warm red in the fading sun .
As big as a cathedral it stood , in red Midland brick and warm Oxford limestone , with the noon sun full upon it .
Whereas greens and blues are cool and make flowers seem to recede , reds and yellows are warm colours that attract attention and stand forward from paler flowers .
For example , cool colours like blue and grey convey a feeling of formality and elegance ; while warm shades of red and orange radiate a cosy intimacy .

Everything in its universe is '70s revival , from the sartorial style -- tight button-down shirts , clingy pants , long straight hair for girls , floppy mops for boys -- to the lighting design , which is warm and dim in the manner of Family and The Brady Bunch , to the static camerawork , as deftly evocative of early '70s television as anything Quentin Tarantino has filmed .
